p: In this first large national study from Iran, high-levels of stress were reported by the general public during the COVID-19 outbreak. Unfortunately, the long-term effect of such high levels of stress, resulting in serious mental health issues, would be an additional burden on the Iranian public and healthcare system as an aftermath of the pandemic. Our findings provide further evidence of the mental health crises created by emerging infectious disease pandemics. Following the outbreaks of HIV, Ebola, and SARS in other countries, the prevalence of psychological symptoms was reported, and many individuals had experienced long-lasting psychiatric problems [ 18, 20, 21, 22].
